intro: Rumfordia verapazensis, commonly known as the Verapazensis Rumfordia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in countries like Guatemala and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
